Articles.Content:
First of all, I have to say great work!  I've been playing KSP since 2012, and I love having it on the console. The game is so complex, I'm impressed with how well you've condensed it down for the xBox controller. 

But... I'm having trouble reading the text in the map view. The font for my Apoapsis/Periapsis for example is so small I can't read them from 5 feet away on my 32" HD TV.  Is there/could there be an adjustment for this in the future?

not really sure how to fix it ingame, but i have no problem Reading it without any "zoomed" gui settings.

 

1st MAKE SURE Your TV itself hasnt used any zoom function, Normaly the default name for the right settings on a 1080 or 720 is called 16:9 (ratio).

 

But i have had simular problems earlier, when playing other games, and might have been on another TV.

 

When i had this problem earlier With another game,

What i had too do, was going into the Display settings of the Xbox, and change the HDMI setting from Auto too manual (HDMI) ,then set up the resolution option too the right settings, prolly 1080P (the default settings seems too be 640:580 or sumthing), & since theres not sooo easy too see missplaced pixels in the menu try going ingame KSP too see if anything gets better after any changes made, since it can be difficult too see any changes in the Xbox menu.

Also if that doesnt fix it, after that try changing out the Colore Space And Colore Depth could'nt hurt.

 

it might just make your GFX in every game that much prettier  

anyways, Gl tho

 

-DaCana

 

Edited July 19, 2016 by DaCana

I have the same issue about font size.   Very difficult to read from my normal game position.  I have this game for MAC as well....same problem.  Font is too small for old eyes and does not appear to be adjustable.  Monkeying around with global TV settings is not an option for me.  Hope they find a way to allow font increase because it is an interesting game.

Not realy the best solution, but it may help: On the ONE you can hold the guide button to bring up the shutdown screen. There press the Option button. This lets you zoom in on the screen.

Edited July 22, 2016 by Monkey-CH
